bibl.title: Letter from Paul H. Streit to Philip Showalter Hench, December 3, 1952

div1.p: Streit is keenly disappointed that he is unable to attend the Camp Lazear dedication because of bad weather.

div1.head: Letter from Paul H. Streit to Philip Showalter Hench, December 3, 1952
div1.opener:
PHS/vc
WALTER REED
ARMY MEDICAL CENTER
WASHINGTON 12, D. C.
OFFICE OF THE COMMANDING GENERAL
3 December 1952
Doctor Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I am inclosing a letter from Major General Walter
Lawrence Reed which I was supposed to give you in person
in Havana this morning. There was a second letter from
General Reed which explained in some detail General Reed's
inability to attend the ceremonies. I took the liberty
of sending this direct to Mr. Exposito for his information.

I have never been so keenly disappointed as I was
yesterday when I could find no way to reach Havana because
of foul weather conditions in the Washington area. I do
hope the ceremony, as planned, was a great success.
With sincere personal regards, I am
div1.closer:
Yours truly, PAUL H. STREIT
Maj Gen, MC
Commanding Inclosure
